biography.value:
Once a mighty angel charged with watching the tides of the Blood War, Zariel succumbed to the corrupting influence of the Nine Hells and fell from grace. Asmodeus admired Zariel’s passion for war and offered her rulership of Avernus. She accepted his offer and was transformed by Asmodeus into an archdevil.

Zariel’s “rise” came at the expense of Bel, her pit fiend predecessor. Zariel and Bel hate each other. To keep Bel busy and out of her sight, Zariel tasks him with forging weapons, armor, and gruesome demon-slaying machines.

To replenish her legions, Zariel needs the souls of mortals to create lemures, which she can then promote to higher forms of devils. Only by tempting mortals with power on the Material Plane and striking bargains with them can she bind them to her in the afterlife.

Matalotok. Zariel recently defeated the demon lord Kostchtchie and took his hammer, Matalotok, which grants Zariel immunity to cold damage. Without this hammer, Zariel has resistance to cold damage instead.

description.value:
Zariel attacks twice with her flail and once with Matalotok. She can substitute Horrid Touch for Matalotok.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 8d8 type=fire average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage, or [[/damage 2d10 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage when used with two hands, plus [[/damage 8d8 type=fire average=true]] damage. In addition, the weapon emits a burst of &Reference[cold]{cold} that deals [[/damage 3d6 type=cold average=true]] damage to each creature within 30 feet of it.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Zariel touches one creature within 10 feet of her. The target must succeed on a [[/save con 26 format=long]] or take [[/damage 8d10 type=necrotic average=true]] damage and be &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned} for 1 minute. While &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned} in this way, the target is also &Reference[blinded]{blinded} and &Reference[deafened]{deafened}. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Zariel magically teleports, along with any equipment she is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space she can see.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Zariel magically teleports, along with any equipment she is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space she can see.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Zariel can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. Zariel regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

Immolating Gaze (Costs 2 Actions). Zariel turns her magical gaze toward one creature she can see within 120 feet of her and commands it to combust. The target must succeed on a [[/save wis 26 format=long]] or take [[/damage 4d10 type=fire average=true]] damage.

Teleport. Zariel uses her Teleport action.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Zariel turns her magical gaze toward one creature she can see within 120 feet of her and commands it to combust. The target must succeed on a [[/save wis 26 format=long]] or take [[/damage 4d10 type=fire average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Devil’s Sight. Magical darkness doesn’t impede Zariel’s &Reference[darkvision]{darkvision}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Fiery Weapons. Zariel’s weapon attacks are magical. When she hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra [[/damage 8d8 type=fire average=true]] damage (included in the weapon attacks below).

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Innate Spellcasting. Zariel’s innate spellcasting ability is &Reference[cha]{Charisma} (spell save DC 26). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components:

At will: alter self (can become Medium when changing her appearance), detect evil and good, fireball, invisibility (self only), wall of &Reference[fire]{fire}

3/day each: blade barrier, dispel evil and good, finger of death

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Legendary Resistance (3/Day). If Zariel fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Magic Resistance. Zariel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Regeneration. Zariel regains [[/damage 20 type=heal average=false]] hit points at the start of her turn. If she takes &Reference[radiant]{radiant} damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of her next turn. Zariel dies only if she starts her turn with 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Special Notes: can become Medium when changing her appearance.

You assume a different form. When you cast the spell, choose one of the following options, the effects of which last for the duration of the spell. While the spell lasts, you can end one option as an action to gain the benefits of a different one.

Aquatic Adaptation. You adapt your body to an aquatic environment, sprouting gills and growing webbing between your fingers. You can breathe underwater and gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

Change Appearance. You transform your appearance. You decide what you look like, including your height, weight, facial features, sound of your voice, hair length, coloration, and distinguishing characteristics, if any. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your statistics change. You also can't appear as a creature of a different size than you, and your basic shape stays the same; if you're bipedal, you can't use this spell to become quadrupedal, for instance. At any time for the duration of the spell, you can use your action to change your appearance in this way again.

Natural Weapons. You grow claws, fangs, spines, horns, or a different natural weapon of your choice. Your unarmed strikes deal 1d6 &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning}, &Reference[piercing]{piercing}, or &Reference[slashing]{slashing} damage, as appropriate to the natural weapon you chose, and you are proficient with your unarmed strikes. Finally, the natural weapon is magic and you have a +1 bonus to the attack and damage rolls you make using it.

items.name: Alter Self (can become Medium when changing her appearance)

description.value:
For the duration, you know if there is an &Reference[aberration]{aberration}, &Reference[celestial]{celestial}, &Reference[elemental]{elemental}, &Reference[fey]{fey}, &Reference[fiend]{fiend}, or &Reference[undead]{undead} within 30 feet of you, as well as where the creature is located. Similarly, you know if there is a place or object within 30 feet of you that has been magically consecrated or desecrated.

The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

A bright streak flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of flame. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} centered on that point must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. A target takes 8d6 &Reference[fire]{fire} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The &Reference[fire]{fire} spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

Special Notes: self only.

A creature you touch becomes &Reference[invisible]{invisible} until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is &Reference[invisible]{invisible} as long as it is on the target's person. The spell ends for a target that attacks or casts a spell.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

You create a wall of &Reference[fire]{fire} on a solid surface within range. You can make the wall up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. The wall is opaque and lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 5d8 &Reference[fire]{fire} damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.

One side of the wall, selected by you when you cast this spell, deals 5d8 &Reference[fire]{fire} damage to each creature that ends its turn within 10 feet of that side or inside the wall. A creature takes the same damage when it enters the wall for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. The other side of the wall deals no damage.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th.

You create a vertical wall of whirling, razor-sharp blades made of magical energy. The wall appears within range and lasts for the duration. You can make a straight wall up to 100 feet long, 20 feet high, and 5 feet thick, or a ringed wall up to 60 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 5 feet thick. The wall provides three-quarters cover to creatures behind it, and its space is difficult terrain.

When a creature enters the wall's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 6d10 &Reference[slashing]{slashing} damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

Shimmering energy surrounds and protects you from &Reference[fey]{fey}, &Reference[undead]{undead}, and creatures originating from beyond the &Reference[material]{Material} Plane. For the duration, celestials, elementals, &Reference[fey]{fey}, fiends, and &Reference[undead]{undead} have disadvantage on attack rolls against you.

You can end the spell early by using either of the following special functions.

Break &Reference[enc]{Enchantment}. As your action, you touch a creature you can reach that is &Reference[charmed]{charmed}, &Reference[frightened]{frightened}, or possessed by a &Reference[celestial]{celestial}, an &Reference[elemental]{elemental}, a &Reference[fey]{fey}, a &Reference[fiend]{fiend}, or an &Reference[undead]{undead}. The creature you touch is no longer &Reference[charmed]{charmed}, &Reference[frightened]{frightened}, or possessed by such creatures.

Dismissal. As your action, make a melee spell attack against a &Reference[celestial]{celestial}, an &Reference[elemental]{elemental}, a &Reference[fey]{fey}, a &Reference[fiend]{fiend}, or an &Reference[undead]{undead} you can reach. On a hit, you attempt to drive the creature back to its home plane. The creature must succeed on a &Reference[cha]{Charisma} saving throw or be sent back to its home plane (if it isn't there already). If they aren't on their home plane, &Reference[undead]{undead} are sent to the Shadowfell, and &Reference[fey]{fey} are sent to the Feywild.

You send negative energy coursing through a creature that you can see within range, causing it searing pain. The target must make a &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw. It takes 7d8 + 30 &Reference[necrotic]{necrotic} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

A &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} killed by this spell rises at the start of your next turn as a zombie that is permanently under your command, following your &Reference[vocal]{verbal} orders to the best of its ability.

edgeCases.name: alter self
edgeCases.edge: can become Medium when changing her appearance
